subject: RE: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: So said  Craig Dickson  on  2002-11-22 ... You probably want something similar to CruiseControl. If you don t know about it, Google it, download it and try it.
messageBody:
So said Craig Dickson on 2002-11-22

>I would definately be interested in an extension to
>the JUnit batchtest task in Ant that could gather the
>tests that had been compiled in the last "x" minutes,
>or even better gather the tests that relate to classes
>(perhaps via naming patterns) that have been compiled
>in the last "x" minutes.

You probably want something similar to CruiseControl. If you don't know
about it, Google it, download it and try it. It's not quite what you
want, but it can be used to build and test your product every 'n'
minutes, and only if there has been CVS activity in the meantime.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
